definition: to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish

sentences.english: The Round Table broke up following the death of Arthur.
sentences.chinese: 亞瑟死後，圓桌騎士各奔東西。

sentences.english: Graduation this day, but also all the beginning of each rush thing.
sentences.chinese: 畢業的這一天，也是大家各奔東西的開端。

sentences.english: Friend just short of excited to meet, then calm each rush thing.
sentences.chinese: 朋友只是短暫激動的相逢，而後平靜的各奔東西。

sentences.english: Everyone is going to drift apart. but I don't know where I belong…
sentences.chinese: 大家即將各奔東西，而我依然不知道自己歸於何處。

sentences.english: In may June finalizing every rushthing.
sentences.chinese: 五月，曲終人散，六月，各奔東西。

sentences.english: And the dear friends have to part.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的朋友只得各奔東西。

sentences.english: Once we performing, now we each rush thing.
sentences.chinese: 曾經我們不離不棄，如今我們各奔東西。

sentences.english: After graduation my classmates drifted apart.
sentences.chinese: 畢業後我們班的同學就各奔東西了。

sentences.english: That time has become today's Gebendongxi never abandon.
sentences.chinese: 彼時的不離不棄，已變成今日的各奔東西。

sentences.english: Or we each go straight towards the things.
With the approaching of graduation all the members became respectively and the society had to be dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 初中畢業後大家各奔東西，哈社也就這樣解散了。

sentences.english: Shaolin Temple since the fire, the South Shaolin sent five old has parted.
sentences.chinese: 自從火燒少林寺後，南少林派五老亦各奔東西。

definition: lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
